events.originalText: People returning from anti-extradition bill protests were attacked (pictured) by suspected triad members in Yuen Long, Hong Kong, leaving 45 people injured.
events.subtitle: 2019–2020 Hong Kong protests
events.headline: Triad members attack protesters in Yuen Long, Hong Kong; 45 injured

events.originalText: Nour Ahmad Nikbakht, an Iranian diplomat in Yemen, was kidnapped by al-Qaeda militants and held hostage for the next two years.
events.subtitle: 2013 Iranian diplomat kidnapping
events.headline: Iranian diplomat Nour Ahmad Nikbakht kidnapped by al-Qaeda militants in Yemen

events.originalText: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, the final book in the popular Harry Potter series by J. K. Rowling, was released and sold 15 million copies in its first 24 hours, making it the fastest-selling book in history.
events.subtitle: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
events.headline: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows sells 15 million copies in 24 hours

events.originalText: The Taiwanese military ordered the deportation of dozens of illegal immigrants from mainland China in sealed boat holds, causing 25 deaths due to suffocation.
events.subtitle: Republic of China Armed Forces
events.headline: Taiwanese military deports illegal immigrants in sealed boat holds; 25 deaths

events.originalText: Libyan forces carried out a raid at Sallum, sparking a four-day war with Egypt.
events.subtitle: Sallum
events.headline: Libyan forces raid Sallum, sparking four-day war with Egypt

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army detonated twenty-two bombs throughout Belfast, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Provisional IRA detonates twenty-two bombs in Belfast, Northern Ireland

events.originalText: Sirimavo Bandaranaike (pictured) was elected the prime minister of Ceylon, becoming the world's first democratically elected female head of government.
events.subtitle: Sirimavo Bandaranaike
events.headline: Sirimavo Bandaranaike elected prime minister of Ceylon, first democratically elected female head of government

events.originalText: The inaugural International Mathematical Olympiad, the leading mathematical competition for pre-university students, began in Romania.
events.subtitle: International Mathematical Olympiad
events.headline: International Mathematical Olympiad begins in Romania

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.3 Mw struck the southern San Joaquin Valley in California, causing 12 deaths and an estimated $60 million in property damage.
events.subtitle: 1952 Kern County earthquake
events.headline: 7.3 magnitude earthquake strikes southern San Joaquin Valley, California; 12 deaths

events.originalText: After several weeks of unrest, rioters shot and lynched Bolivian President Gualberto Villarroel, desecrating and hanging his corpse in the streets of La Paz.
events.subtitle: 1946 La Paz riots
events.headline: Rioters shoot and lynch Bolivian President Gualberto Villarroel in La Paz

events.originalText: American high school biology teacher John T. Scopes was found guilty of violating Tennessee's Butler Act by teaching evolution in class.
events.subtitle: John T. Scopes
events.headline: John T. Scopes found guilty of teaching evolution in Tennessee

events.originalText: World War I: An Imperial German Navy U-boat opened fire on a small convoy of barges and defending aircraft near the American town of Orleans, Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Imperial German Navy U-boat fires on convoy near Orleans, Massachusetts

events.originalText: Much of central Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, was burned and looted during the Great Railroad Strike of 1877.
events.subtitle: Pittsburgh
events.headline: Pittsburgh burned and looted during Great Railroad Strike of 1877

events.originalText: Unrepresented labourers revolted and violently took over the government of the Republic of Florence, demanding that they be granted political office.
events.subtitle: Ciompi Revolt
events.headline: Labourers revolt and take over government in Republic of Florence

events.originalText: Louis III, Holy Roman Emperor, was captured and blinded during his attempt to restore Carolingian power over Italy by King Berengar I.
events.subtitle: Louis the Blind
events.headline: Holy Roman Emperor Louis III captured and blinded by King Berengar I

events.originalText: Paulinus of York consecrated as the first Bishop of York by Justus
events.subtitle: Paulinus of York
events.headline: Paulinus of York consecrated as first Bishop of York by Justus

events.originalText: A large earthquake occurred near Crete, triggering a tsunami, and causing widespread destruction around the eastern Mediterranean region.
events.subtitle: AD 365
events.headline: Earthquake near Crete triggers tsunami in eastern Mediterranean region

events.originalText: Pope Pontian began his pontificate, succeeding Urban I.
events.subtitle: Pope Pontian
events.headline: Pope Pontian begins pontificate, succeeding Urban I
